trans-unit.source: Choosing Authentication for a Service Bus Application
trans-unit.target: Choosing Authentication for a Service Bus Application

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior</codeEntityReference> behavior is a <token>indigo1</token> class that is used to specify the <token>sb2</token> authentication credentials for a particular endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior</codeEntityReference> behavior is a <token>indigo1</token> class that is used to specify the <token>sb2</token> authentication credentials for a particular endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Instances of this behavior are shareable across endpoints so that the descriptions of multiple endpoints (listener and channels) using the same <token>sb2</token> credentials can be populated with the same configured instance of this class.
trans-unit.target: Instances of this behavior are shareable across endpoints so that the descriptions of multiple endpoints (listener and channels) using the same <token>sb2</token> credentials can be populated with the same configured instance of this class.

trans-unit.source: The behavior can be defined and applied to endpoints in code and in configuration files.
trans-unit.target: The behavior can be defined and applied to endpoints in code and in configuration files.

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior</codeEntityReference> members
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior</codeEntityReference> members

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Configuration.TransportClientEndpointBehaviorElement.CredentialType</codeEntityReference> property specifies which authentication method will be used on the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Configuration.TransportClientEndpointBehaviorElement.CredentialType</codeEntityReference> property specifies which authentication method will be used on the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The possible values for this property are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The possible values for this property are as follows:

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior.TokenProvider</codeEntityReference>: specifies that a custom token provider credential is used to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior.TokenProvider</codeEntityReference>: specifies that a custom token provider credential is used to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The token provider supports the use of Saml, OAuth, shared secret, SAS, simple Web, and Windows tokens.
trans-unit.target: The token provider supports the use of Saml, OAuth, shared secret, SAS, simple Web, and Windows tokens.

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientCredentialType.Saml</codeEntityReference>: this option specifies that the client credential is provided in the Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) format, over the Secure Sockets Layer protocol.
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientCredentialType.Saml</codeEntityReference>: this option specifies that the client credential is provided in the Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) format, over the Secure Sockets Layer protocol.

trans-unit.source: This option requires that you write your own SSL credential server.
trans-unit.target: This option requires that you write your own SSL credential server.

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientCredentialType.SharedSecret</codeEntityReference>: This option specifies that the client credential is provided as a self-issued shared secret that is registered with <token>ac2</token> through the <token>azure_2</token> portal.
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientCredentialType.SharedSecret</codeEntityReference>: This option specifies that the client credential is provided as a self-issued shared secret that is registered with <token>ac2</token> through the <token>azure_2</token> portal.

trans-unit.source: This option requires no additional settings on the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior.Credentials</codeEntityReference> property.
trans-unit.target: This option requires no additional settings on the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior.Credentials</codeEntityReference> property.

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientCredentialType.SimpleWebToken</codeEntityReference>: This option specifies that the client credential is provided as a self-issued shared secret that is registered with <token>ac2</token> through the <token>azure_2</token> portal, and presented in the emerging industry-standard format called simple Web token (SWT).
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientCredentialType.SimpleWebToken</codeEntityReference>: This option specifies that the client credential is provided as a self-issued shared secret that is registered with <token>ac2</token> through the <token>azure_2</token> portal, and presented in the emerging industry-standard format called simple Web token (SWT).

trans-unit.source: Similar to the shared secret option, this option requires no additional settings on the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior.Credentials</codeEntityReference> property.
trans-unit.target: Similar to the shared secret option, this option requires no additional settings on the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior.Credentials</codeEntityReference> property.

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientCredentialType.Unauthenticated</codeEntityReference>: This option specifies that there is no client credential provided.
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientCredentialType.Unauthenticated</codeEntityReference>: This option specifies that there is no client credential provided.

trans-unit.source: This option avoids acquiring and sending a token.
trans-unit.target: This option avoids acquiring and sending a token.

trans-unit.source: It is used by clients that are not required to authenticate, based on the policy of their service binding.
trans-unit.target: It is used by clients that are not required to authenticate, based on the policy of their service binding.

trans-unit.source: Note that this setting might leave data non-secure if not used together with another security measure.
trans-unit.target: Note that this setting might leave data non-secure if not used together with another security measure.

trans-unit.source: This property refers to the composite credentials container <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Description.TransportClientCredentials</codeEntityReference>, which holds the specific credentials for the credential types described earlier in this section.
trans-unit.target: This property refers to the composite credentials container <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Description.TransportClientCredentials</codeEntityReference>, which holds the specific credentials for the credential types described earlier in this section.
